ZBIDQqO3UQaLBu-FIq63Ag.text: Walking through Covent Garden in mid Feb, we stumbled on this "burger restaurant"Burgers were yummy, School type tables/desks were fun and the waiting staff were helpful and friendly. reasonably priced too.

m3FBY9q1XEeDxF4U1Tx_qQ.text: I've been to Byron a few times but never to this particular branch in Covent Garden. They specialise in burgers and they do a pretty good job of it as I have always enjoyed what I have ordered. On this particular occasion I had the Byron Bacon burger which was very tasty. The service was very good and this has always been the case with any of my visits. My only criticism/feedback is there is no drink included in the kids menu and on the main menu there are no fries included with the burgers. Surely this is a popular combo (ie burger and fries) and adding them together would give customers more value for money. Lastly, I would have no hesitation in recommending Byron to friends, family & strangers!

OBwrIVy9nq-06RaQRXZVvg.text: Really enjoyed it here, and it's lovely to go to a burger restaurant that hasn't neglected vegetarians, as the suitable option was amazing, definitely one of the best veggie burgers I've had. Side orders were delicious too, and the food is filling. Service was friendly and efficient, despite it being a busy evening.

EsUAvOdibpd_--feC02d_g.text: As far as burger restaurants go this one is defiantly up there. The service is super speedy but you're not given the impression they want you out of there as soon as you finish. I had the chicken burger and my partner had the bacon burger and they were both excellent burgers. The price was reasonable for central London and if I'm in the area and in the mood for a burger it will defiantly be stopping back in.

photos.caption: Photo of Byron - London, United Kingdom

aoS-4fM1kKyHGoo0LiwgmA.text: tasty burger good service milk shakes are tasty only down side was straw was a bit think of the shake chips were really tasty & nachoes were nice quite  good value too

Z_hw5Gua48EFsM7r8ErsGw.text: I like Byron's for the most part.  The burger's are okay, and the rolls are excellent.  Fries tend to be underwhelming which is sad when you think about how much you pay for the darn things.This particular location is just so DARK inside, which is suprisingly considering that there are windows and I was sitting next to one.  It felt like I could barely see inside.  Yet, the people who work at this location were SO outstandingly friendly while I was there, I felt like I was back in Midwest USA!  It was really nice to have someone sincerely seem to want to provide a great service. It made me give an extra star on the whole experience.

PuULm95bCBMq1EZBise6sQ.text: What is it about familiarity breeding contempt? Well perhaps this cliche is true.... After a grand start both in central London and in the outskirts of Cambridge as expressed in previous reviews...we found our pre theatre lunch a little meh....ok, but not great and certainly on the expensive side.  The lovely bright and breezy waitress explained that our burgers would be cooked medium rare, all good for us. But mine arrived a uniform grey colour and distinctly luke warm. Therein lies the problem....no doubt about it, our food had been waiting for us. The fries were well seasoned but lacked that just cooked bite and the onion rings were bordering on flabby. Come on Byron, you started so well, don't let us down now!

r7E70O8-nb1b24mMJRJ9xA.text: This is a new location for Bryon's.  I had a Byron burger today and it was  really good.  The bun didn't break apart and the burger was nice and juicy.  Crispy bacon and cheese were there to accompany the juicy burger in great harmony.  As a side I got to try some courgette (aka zucchini) fries, they were good but the onion rings were amazing. The waitstaff were really nice and helpful too, refreshing to see that in London.

photos.caption: Photo of Byron - London, United Kingdom. The dining area
Photo of Byron - London, United Kingdom. The Byron Burger

Z6jiZM6GEADGZp7xB_RDtg.text: Service was very good. The burger was not bad. The fries were greasy and not good. And £6 for a beer in a can?! No thanks. It's fine for a group of people but "I've experienced better" is my rating.

yXJQC_KvmLJX5E3ZX6tIYQ.text: Great service, delicious food! I've only been here once so I can't confidently give Byron 5 stars, but I'd love to come back again.

d3_EAjpEGGG54gqUB_BybA.text: A swishy but non-overpriced burger joint!  I ordered a veggie burger, which was really, really good - great fixings (some rather gourmet!) and the fries were also perfectly done.   Accommodating for large groups, and probably the only decently priced place in Covent Garden.

B0XGtZ7-yI-llK4EXYaW-A.text: After playing tourist for an afternoon my husband I wanted some place to sit and enjoy a nice quick lunch. We found Byron and was seated soon enough without having to wait. Sweet.The restaurant has very high ceilings and very open, which is great for people watching. The only unsavory sight was seeing a waiter's butt crack here and there. Why did he bother to wear a belt and not cinch it enough to do its job is beyond me. Hmm...I digress.We ordered a hamburger, onion rings and mac and cheese. The hamburger had a great smoky flame broiled taste. Very yum. The batter on the onion rings was crispy but not flimsy and falling apart. But the rings could have stood to be less oily. As for the mac and cheese...*drum roll* It was okay. Nothing much to write home or here about. It was cheesy but not creamy. And everyone knows mac and cheese has to be both!So I would go back for the burger. Definitely one of the better burgers I've had since moving here.

Pt3tp512opyeyB5N6hGYLQ.text: It was 2PM and we waited forever (20min) to get to order the food, had to go grab a waiter, were told they were "doing their best". If that's the best they can do, I'll go elsewhere. Didn't get any apology, but from that everything went smoothly, food was pretty correct.

Ut4fFUFxBfPbw7FBjY6_yA.text: Very happy with a visit to Byron, Covent Garden today. Quick service, friendly staff and a nice atmosphere. No outside seating, but as it was sunny, we had the window seat with it all the way open and it was really nice.The burger was a good wholesome bite. It had a good savoury dryness about it. The last burger I had was Meat Liquor and after that I was actually anxious to eat another! I was happy with this. A decent crisp bread roll, not greased up. The skin-on chips were good. A little pricey if you compare to Bodean's for example, but all in all a nice place to take someone to lunch.

lxhVHHGhK5yQSu21VkvP3A.text: Great fast service and excellent burgers. Menu is refreshingly simple and to the point. Love this place. They're also on twitter @byronhamburgers

ljCwPD_oivvV3mydhBQ0vw.text: Tasty, nicely cooked burgers with the perfect amount of toppings, and a simple but nice ambiance. The only downsides were that it could have been a teensy bit cheaper (although very competitive for the area), service wasn't the fastest, and some of the seating is a bit cramped. Nevertheless, recommended for a really tasty burger, fries&coke that won't break the bank.

NJ0iqvOnKnhiEMN1JUHTpw.text: Gourmet burger joint in Covent Garden.  Prices are reasonable.  They specialize in organic and natural ingredients.  Not bad, but the US has the monopoly on great burgers.

7HoHW8LYWPfNgU7LauHsQw.text: The hamburger was FANTASTIC.  The service was HORRIBLE.1st off, they were not busy.  The manager came by and took my initial order and he was Johnny-on-the-spot!  I ordered a burger, medium-rare with french fries and a milk shake.  Nothing earth shattering.  No special orders.I think because the manager took my order the waitresses couldn't figure out who should help with my table.  I asked the woman who gave me my hamburger if my milkshake was ready.  She responded that they take a ". . .long time to go through the blender.".  What does that mean?!?  I've made milkshakes before and it doesn't really take that long to go through any blender.  I thought maybe milkshakes take longer in the UK.  People drive on the other side of the road, I have to have some weird plug adapter if I want to plug in any electronics. . .it's feasible, it could be different.  She then took ten minutes to bring me another glass of water and I finally had to ask for my check since I was sitting there for ten minutes having finished everything.  I asked for my check, she brought it and the milkshake was still on there!  Did she think someone else brought it?  Did I mysteriously drink it so fast she didn't see it and then eat the glass it was enclosed in?  I then had to ask her to take it off the bill.  She never offered.  She never said, "Sorry 'bout that".  with or without a British accent.  Nothing. Nada.Look, here's the deal.  Service can make or break a restaurant and my service was awful which is why I am rating it 2 stars.  Chances are that if you go, you won't get my waitress with red hair.  If you do, beware.  She's slow, disinterested in her job and doesn't care.  If you don't get her, you should have a great meal and the restaurant itself also looks great inside with updated and cool decor.  And again, great food as well and the burgers do rock.

kXMue63dzDatSQdh2NO-Nw.text: 1) overfriendly staff: i don't like posh places and being called sir or poured water constantly, but I also don't like to be treated like a mate or - worse - a matey. i can understand it's a age factor (everybody including the patrons were very young making me feel very old), but please don't call me mate.2) the decor reminds me of a decrepite version of my primary school in italy, 30 something years ago, i would rather sit in more comfort at this point3) quick service4) i had a cheeseburger with bacon, no bun, with fries.it was ok, perhaps a little bit too small, there are no size options. a gherking came with the burger and it was most welcome. the fries were ok but not special.5) menu is perfect and simple and shows the commitment to being a hamburger restaurant.6) all looked nice and clean and clean bathroom too. the restaurant seems to be fairly new.definitely a good place but also not the best hamburger, i would go back but only if i didn't have a better place to go to.

xNhMWycsNjCmICvw5ciuIA.text: Great burgers and drinks. The location is big, clean and spacious with two floors and plenty of bathrooms. I liked the booth tables as they were next to the large windows which allowed you to get fresh air on such a hot day. We ordered regular cheeseburgers, the ronaldinho burger and chicken burger which we were all very happy with.  Not bad for being in London.

I8cGJcYojxlg9z8umevGpg.text: A great little restaurant, which delivered on taste and service. Burgers cooked well, with just the right amount of filling and sauce and the strawberry milkshake was divine - real bits of strawberries in the shake which made it über strawberry in flavour. The mac and cheese and homemade chips were delish! Give me more! Service was great - prompt and efficient and we were shown to a table straight away. Would return for more burger juiciness!

TI49ZDLNAIRG26T3pfmz2w.text: The Byron Burger at Byron comes down to simple execution. The Byron Sauce is salty and tangy and the beef I ordered was cooked a juicy medium. The bun is soft and savory and complements the cured bacon. Melted mature cheddar holds it all together and a classic combination of tomato, lettuce, pickle, and red onion top it off. Finely tuned ingredients and complementary pairings of sweet, salty, and savory along with a good texture make each make you hope it is not the last.

photos.caption: Photo of Byron - London, United Kingdom. Byron Burger

_rqVMbT7geCBp4q9MY4pwA.text: I don't like going to chain restaurants - would prefer to stick to independent restaurants without a cookie-cutter menu and supplier.  But, my friend said Byron Burgers are REALLY good... sigh ... so alright, off I went.. and it was definitely one of the best burgers I've ever had.The price is a bit steep: I got the Byron Burger for £9.75, which has bacon, cheese, lettuce, tomato, onion, pickle and special sauce.  If you want fries, its an extra...£3-3.50?  The burgers will make you plenty full, so if you do want fries, its best to share.They ask you how you want your patty done, which I got a bit weirded out by since I felt that minced meat should always be cooked through and not served anything less than that.  But I asked for medium rare, and it was fantastic!  Melt in your mouth patty, I just wolfed this thing down.  Chips - they're chips!  can't go wrong.. but a bit steepColeslaw - good, would rather get this than chipsOnion Rings - nothing to rave aboutMac N Cheese - didn't suck, but definitely had better elsewhere.The burger was heaven, but was it worth £9.75.... its a bit pricey.  I would expect some really kick-ass toppings for that price.  Next time, I will also ask if I can replace the cheddar cheese with something else like a blue cheese. or Monteray Jack.  Hope they don't charge for a substitute, esp since they have a "pick your own cheese" burger.Still - 2 thumbs up.

bx3kLCfn6Hy3I_oWQ2l9YA.text: In a sheep like tourist packed strip of chain restaurants running along the arse of Covent Garden towards the Strand, Byron doesn't initially stand out. It's a fairly substantial chain of its own now, ten restaurants strong stretching from Kingston to Canary Wharf. Despite my misgivings of chain restaurants generally, I have to admit that Byron appears to be really rather quite good. It's a clean, tiled room with church hall style chairs and basic decor. There's a cavernous space downstairs that I hope fills out regularly.It was a quick bite, post and prior to a few beers. I went for the Byron Burger and courgette fries. Never having had courgette fries, I was pleasantly surprised. Soft and juicy courgette strips, in a light and crispy batter. Perfect. The burger was cooked medium, with a beautiful pink colour. The charred flavour I was hoping for only came through in the last last few mouthfuls but it was there, and it was good. There was a nice tang to the cheese, though the bacon was a little thick and came away in lumps.

photos.caption: Photo of Byron - London, United Kingdom

PzrUcI3hYC90LV4SC_bUBw.text: Le Smokey fizzled. My group was looking for affordable options in the Covent Gardens area and chose Byron. The burgers looked interesting and they had a reputation. Le Smokey is their special burger right now and it sounded promising. Smoky bacon, smoked chili bbq sauce, crispy onion rings, Scottish beef. Well, the delivered burger didn't match my expectations. First, the bacon was waffish and translucent. Whatever flavor that bacon may have offered was swallowed up by the tasty crispy onions. Also, I ordered the burger medium well and it ranged, left to right, from medium well to medium rare. I never saw a burger that inconsistently done before. On a more positive note, they do good pickling.

F5w82aZJvqfm2gov0HQOtw.text: For a burger joint this is not good. I really don't understand why there are so many of these restaurants littered around London. The meat in the burger was average and the bun was thick and dry! Both things need to be spot on every time. Perhaps I went on a bad day when they had stale buns. But I tell you, I won't be spending money in here again to find out!Checkout Red Dog Saloon, Honest Burgers, or Dirty Burger instead.

liXX8-b4rbcRNHTWHDLTbA.text: Byron is the ultimate answer to whether there's a decent burger to be had outside the states, and it's with an ear-shattering and resounding HELLS YEAH.Byron is Van Gogh's sunflowers. Beethoven's fifth. Homer's Odyssey. It is basically the greatest fucking burger you will ever taste on this planet, aside from the Olympus-quality steakburgers served at Lark Creek Steak in San Francisco.Any burger ordered up medium rare is guaranteed to kick off a satisfying afternoon.

_oAxU4oPNEcAn4APF3omuw.text: Probably one of the best burgers I have ever eaten. I got the cheeseburger with mature cheddar. The meat was cooked perfectly. It comes medium and really is medium. The cheddar was very tasty. You could tell that they use quality ingredients. The fries were very good and the onion rings are the best I've had. My husband and I found this while walking around the neighborhood and we were so thankful that we gave it a try. We did not receive horrible service. Our server was quite friendly and attentive.

photos.caption: Photo of Byron - London, United Kingdom

cmtTgAOd1Ws0jAwZdTefww.text: Byron gets the burger chain formula totally right. Quality meat, reasonable price, with enough originality on the menu and in the venue design to make it feel different from the next place. Is it going to blow you away for being a high class, unique, sense-busting culinary experience? No, but it doesn't need to - because it's strength is when you want to keep things simple, easy and cheap.  A tip: go or the courgette fries - they're delicious.

mN7ob4xVQ17fIiRjiTPhdw.text: Burger was just not that tasty.  It wasn't seasoned well and tasted quite plain.  Really cannot say anything more.

JKA9_oF3jROMfRiTqudgsQ.text: They have great burgers specialy the smoky one. I was starving and there were many customers the service was perfect and i had my burger very soon I'll highly recommend this place ....enjoy

H5GRhSeQ8wO6jMggsI8A4g.text: Great choice for Paleo-minded eaters!  My Bun Less Skinny Burger with bacon and avocado was delicious!  You may have to wait - it was worth it :). Great staff!

gsiYK4uzNn417cWDelvhZA.text: My burger was tough, but it wasn't a terrible experience. Pretty fast service, and it was packed. But yep, if you're an American (that thinks that Americans have some sort of special burger palette) looking for a good burger joint - keep moving, Tex.

2OfwS19OXEuNlOqGizsDwA.text: Great place, food was really good. Service outstanding.  All in all I would definitely visit again, maybe tomorrow.

5Zm92nqjfEOC0knrttALJA.text: Since moving to London from the States, I've been on the hunt for good old fashioned Americana-y food and Byron has pretty much been the answer. For hamburgers, at least. Simple and straight to the point, the burgers are juice and delicious and they taste like a sticky summer night when my dad's just flipped them off the grill. Cooked perfectly with the classic toppings and a coke in a glass bottle, it's just the best. Hits the spot. The people watching is great because there is always such a diverse clientele and i always get a giggle out of people who sit daintily and sip their wine while eating their burger with a knife and fork. My only complaint is that the tables are a little close together and I've been stuck awkwardly, and unintentionally listening in on my neighbors conversations.

AEZj-Cf1yDEo0dTQvJQJ4g.text: Fun and quick staff, delicious sauces and burgers that can make a person weep. I hope this place does not change. I have had a number of their menu items, yeah somehow I can still walk, and have found each to be a good decision. I will point out the super thin chips are a bit of a waste for me. It is almost like a unhelpful game of pick-up sticks when trying to eat them. The rosemary addition is close to useless. three tiny leaves of rosemary on one chip is a little far from the advertisement. That being said, a great place to bring friends, or co-workers, and enjoy a couple of juicy burgers, chips and a shake on the side!

cJ-VZWHpqTQWmwuAZiNR6g.text: Basically went in to kill a burger craving & it did the job.We each had a cooked to medium emmenthal burger & shared some skin-on french fries. Glass each of malbec because the milkshakes were a 15 minute wait. Service was efficient, no issues. Would return but too many other burger joints in London to try out.

DsVBeuzjZfHKzXXWMGMIBg.text: It's decent. Unlike most here, though, I think I prefer GBK. The blue cheese on the burger was a bit weak, and while it's great they have Brew Dog, somehow being handed a can for £4.25 stings a bit. I'd go if they were nearby and I were lazy, but they're not, so it'll be GBK for me in the future.

3EtPM7SoAVq1j25PXZmxEA.text: It's one of the those very few places in town that you can find a combination of good quality food, friendly service and reasonable price. I am so impressed by the staff and how lovely they all were- enjoyed the food very much- I confidently can say that it is the best burger you can get in townI think the place still need more variety in menu, but overall my experience in three branches in central London was absolutely positive

fyyw7aLDJNGrP3_BBJYmEA.text: We went to this burger joint for my birthday lunch today. Hubby had reserved a table but it was not too busy at 2pm and we were seated straight away. Service to start of with was very good and quick. Ordered some wings for a starter and they were yummy, particularly loved the blue cheese dip. We all had the cheese fries with bacon. They were good but a little light on the cheese. Husband had the Reuben burger. He says it's messy to eat but totally worth it. Daughter had double bacon and cheese and she loved it. I had the big smoke. It was tasty but felt it was a little light on the bbq pulled pork, was kind of a hit and miss. We also had milkshakes. Oreo and Mississippi mud something. They were amazing. Best Oreo milkshake I have had in a long time. Had the brownie with ice cream for dessert which was very good and Oreo cheesecake freakshakes which were beautifully presented and tasted amazing.Service at the end was a little slow, took ages to get the bill but it's all good. Will return here.

8gxxQtJlspB-ghDGkYGRZA.text: Just what I needed. American style burgers and fries. I did not say crisps I said fries! The atmosphere is pretty cool here. They have an average noise level and friendly wait staff. Luckily they also take Apple Pay; or else I may have been washing dishes while I was there. I am traveling in London and forgot my credit card in my dress pockets from the day before. I came I. Ate then realized no card. Yay Apple Pay saved me. The food was good. I asked for medium rare and I got medium rare. I know it's just a burger but cooked right makes all the difference to me. They even had ketchup on the table. I like not having to ask for normal stuff at a burger place. I am sure to stop in here again for a comfortable and affordable meal. The prices were fairly descent for the area. The food service was also fairly quick. One last thing. When I ran my Apple Pay charge. They didn't force me to rip them.  They actually bypassed the tip screen and handed the machine with just my good bill. This was different to me and so I asked them if I could tip and I did. Ok I recommend this somewhat American burger joint.

photos.caption: Photo of Byron - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Byron - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Byron - London, United Kingdom

P0ek0CvVK7fpSP84fwtDfw.text: Maybe I came on an off day?I came here on recommendation of a friend. After ordering, we sat...and sat...and sat probably for about thirty minutes. The tables around us got served including people who came in after us. We never even received it beverages! The waitress kept glancing at us but never came close enough for us to flag down. We finally were able to grab her and she apparently said our ticket had been closed and we had received our food. (She also didn't remember she was our waiter). She re entered our order and it finally came...with a mistake. Sigh. To be fair, she did discount our food for her mistakes.So how was the food? Ehh it was okay. The burgers are a bit on the smaller side...similar in size to Shake Shack. The Bryon cheese was a bit thick and I'm fairly certain Byron sauce is the same special sauce...that thousand island type sauce..,a lot of places use. The cheese fries were crispy but had very little sauce. I guess for those looking for a taste of America they may enjoy it? But guys, we do burgers much much better.

TuxpCXIDPPmtVIX7tr4v9w.text: Byron is awesome. I got a nine of hearts here, some courgette fries, and a mature cheddar burger. I even read the little story about the founder that restaurants really love writing about and it resonated with me in mind and stomach. Thanks Byron youre the real MVP.

2iOkuypKODOLpMOYm9ZoKQ.text: Most stressful pre theatre meal ever. In fact worst restaurant experience ever. Long wait times, bad service and mice.We were going to see a show and arrived here with 1 hour 15 to spare. After being told the wait time is 35 minutes but being assured that would be fine, we sat down. Upstairs full, downstairs fairly busy. We're not asked for drinks when seated but we look through the menu. We quickly decided what we wanted and tried to catch the attention of the waiter who knew we were in a hurry. The response is everyone is going to the theatre we just need to wait. At this point I'm killing for a drink, there's a guy behind the bar but he ignores us. After asking someone for water and waiting ten minutes we ask someone else, who gets us the glass that had been on the side since we walk in, and a jug with a couple glasses. Fortunately our friend didn't want to drink.After 20 minutes we get to order our food. While we wait, the couple next to us well arrived after us has managed to get food already. That annoyed me. Downstairs is starting to empty now. The couple next to us finish and we still haven't got food. We keep asking to be told it's coming. While waiting we watch a mouse scurry across the floor which freaks my friend out but I'm not leaving we need to eat. Makes her anxious the rest of the night. After 45 minutes we go to leave, there's one couple left downstairs and upstairs is quiet. As we head up we say to the waiter we have to go he just says nonchalantly that 'it's ok don't worry' like are you for real? It's not bloody ok we've sat here for an hour and not got food. Upstairs we walk out the door and my friend turns to see food under the great lamp that looks like it could be for us.... We asked and it was, so we wolf down the mediocre food in 5 minutes and rush to the theatre with literal minutes until start. No time to argue the wait time and everything so we paid full price without the whisper of even an apology. I don't hate many food places but fuck Byron burgers.

8coiLl5xvihZbQf6NR4V6Q.text: Was looking for an inexpensive burger joint and happened upon Byron. We were seated immediately and quickly received our pitcher of water. We ordered the Halloumi fries, fried pickles, and the nuggets (decided to forego the burger). Everything was amazing! The chicken nuggets were delicious and the BBQ sauce was great. The fried pickles and Halloumi fries contained the perfect ratio of breading to cheese/pickles. They were fantastic. £14 for all of it, which seemed like a great deal to me. We will definitely be returning.

0P7WG8x6vd9lRHjiLbLHcQ.text: Great service. Nice location. My wife and I had the mushroom goat's cheese burger with fries and onion rings. I was surprised by the way the flavors worked together on the burger, but overall it was nice. Smoky with a hint of savory. Onion rings had a nice thick batter. Chips were as expected.

photos.caption: Photo of Byron - London, United Kingdom

2s39IATFKqPcwARIx_NJEw.text: Great burger. Fries need work.Americans love freedom fries, as much if not more than the meat.Byron's served what was needed. Ambience is stuffy and cold. If you're going to make burgers an art, why no table cloths, wall art?Rebel Review: 4 stars

photos.caption: Photo of Byron - London, United Kingdom

QZAamOkKeutsJz-DVm2VJQ.text: I've tried a few of London burgers and I've got to say that Byron's are definitely in my top 3 ! The beef is always perfectly cooked (medium rare for me, but they ask you every time), bun is pretty good too and the service is great ! The salad is a good choice but so is the coleslaw and well, the fries too. I've never been disappointed at Byron !

photos.caption: Photo of Byron - London, United Kingdom

SgI62N3axyVZws0UZFZw-w.text: We came here to eat from the USA! The burgers were very tasty, the drinks were great and well priced. The fries were crispy and delicious. Overall, amazing service and a great place to stop for a bite to eat!

Eydtg3Y26D4ncetC-xSAzw.text: Really solid chicken sandwich and burger.  they also have a good selection of craft beer (gamma ray was on the list when i was there).

eE66rMdn6r__wsiVtUvmHg.text: We were lucky to have Jacob for our waiter. He was charming, informative and funny. Didn't treat us like stupid tourists. The food was great. We had Cobb salad, macaroni and cheese, cheeseburgers, cole slaw, onion rings, chips, and fried zucchini. Everything was prepared as requested. He kept our drinks refilled and cleared off empty plates quickly. He even gave us tips for fun things to do. Great first British restaurant experience for our kids.

_b8BK5uQYmNYhtZUyQ2HWg.text: Came here after a night of drinking in Covent Garden (celebrating the Detroit Lions win earlier in the day in London) and was looking for something to eat and stumble upon Byron hamburgers. Ordered a couple of beers (they only serve it in a can, no draft) and of course food. For food I had a burger (excellent burger, one of the better ones I have ever had), chips/fries (good not great) and their macaroni and cheese (amazing, one of the 3-5 best Mac n cheese I have ever had). Overall I would come here again for a burger and macaroni and cheese.

VP6MYtehEnQTpVIRPBAj2g.text: They hugely messed up our orders and offered us free burgers on the house the next time we wanted to visit. Four stars for knowing how to rectify a bad customer experience.

dW0LQZh3JXaCfOtrRle7Ew.text: Had great service and a very good burger here before going to see The Lion King. We had only 40 minutes to get a bite, no reservations, and neither I nor the mrs. were very hungry. Byron's took us in right away, took our drink and food order quickly, and the food came out fast! The standard cheeseburger was cooked perfectly medium with a good blend of gooey cheese and the side of onion rings were fresh and homemade. Jacob, our awesome server, was engaging, friendly and even offered to split our shared burger for us. We got our food so fast we even had time for dessert! We tried a banana, caramel and "biscuit" concoction not knowing what we were getting into. It ended up being a parfait-like banana pudding (delish) and the "biscuit" was actually layers of graham crackers. Silly Brits and their "biscuits"...

hQf08alEPLFUMYpMSu-Y-w.text: I first discovered Byron's accidentally while wandering near Holborn Underground Station (it's also walking distance from Charring Cross) looking for food after a film/lecture at LSE. We had a short wait at 9ish on a Friday, probably about 10-15 minutes. On our return visit, also a Friday, we had the same wait at 730.As soon as we sat down I was convinced this was American owned. Who else but an American would know to put Cholula and French's mustard on every table, put Sierra Nevada on tap on the menu and offer classics like no frills cheeseburgers and milkshakes simply and without the Americana kitsch so commonly assigned to these types of restaurants in the UK?Turns out I was wrong. It's British owned but the guy did his homework, and certainly fooled this Yankee. The burgers are high-quality meat, served simply and with all the right fixins: tomato, special sauce (probably ketchup and mayo blend), sliced red onion and fresh, leafy green lettuce. Optional add ons are a variety of cheeses, bacon, avocado. The burgers are just the right size, juicy and the choice in meat quality is distinct. The bun is a bit too soft for my preference but not a meal ruiner. The service is pretty good, with the server smiling and checking back twice after the meal was delivered and even chatting us up a bit. This location is quite large, with a downstairs area as well as more than two dozen tables at ground level. We got an Oreo sundae on our last visit, and it was only so-so. I would prefer a better quality ice cream and there was little Oreo about it, save for the cookie being added to the top and maybe a half of another crushed up into the rest.But overall I'm really impressed with this burger place's offerings and ambience. Worth a try if you like good quality burgers, American or otherwise.

z6XH8yxbrm_8Ro-LiVs4dg.text: 6oz medium rare, juicy plain hamburger - - enough said. Get your hamburger craving groove on....oh, also tried the veggie burger, also tasty. Went in for weekday lunch around 12:30p and there was no line. Fast, friendly service. No hassle and no grief if you don't order fries.

5XvgasdxbC3YJPszqcLFTQ.text: For vegetarians there is the portebello burger. Burgers don't come with sides or fries, that's extra. That said, I ordered a Cobb salad and it was massive and delicious and so filling! crisp juicy lettuce, spinach, chargrilled chx, crispy and chewy bacons, creamy avocado. I skipped the blue cheese and subbed with a grano padano. I didn't even need to dress it. It was that delicious. AND MASSIVE (did i mention it already?) It was bigger than my face.  Go for Croquettes fries if you like your fried zucchini which was yummmmm. Fries are stringy ones and you couldn't go wrong with it.  Busy, loud, great service. Will come back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Byron - London, United Kingdom. I'm so full from my cobb salad. Yum.

uJpZzR5NqWPBjUCXnCn_Sw.text: Great tasting burgers (definitely agree with their slogan - "Proper hamburgers") with interesting options for sides. Really love their onion rings and courgette fries, as the batter is so tasty. Also love that they do skinny fries. The staff are very friendly and attentive. Lovely booths in this branch - giving a cosy, American feel.

photos.caption: Photo of Byron - London, United Kingdom. Onion rings
Photo of Byron - London, United Kingdom. Amazing burger (with a gherkin on the side)

mgLUqqkYumuuHoilQbEWTA.text: LONDON RESTAURANTS!  I MUST HAVE YOUR ATTENTION! This Byron knows good service.Seriously.  No, seriously.Okay so Byron burgers aren't going to top the list of anyone's favorite burger on the planet.  But as far as chains go, Byron does the job and does the job better than the other popular chain GBK.  I had a Roquefort burger which was cooked perfectly, along with skin on chips which were also tasty, although slightly lacking in salt, and a chocolate oreo shake.  All were good and perfectly serviceable.  The crispy red onion on the Roquefort burger really makes it quite tasty.  Totally recommend.But what I want to talk about is the service.  Our group of 9 walked in at 7:50, having booked a table at 8pm.  Whoops.  They couldn't find our booking.  Well, that's not great.  So the host looked around and said that if we went to get a drink, he would have a table for us by 8:15.  Okay, it's a bit inconvenient, but not killer.So our group went across the road to Sophie's for a drink.  Get our beverages, and suddenly we turn around to see that the Byron host had walked over to tell us that our table was ready and to take our time and come back whenever we're ready.  I was impressed by this alone.  How nice is that?Then, halfway through our meal, the manager walks up, unsolicited, and says "I understand there was an issue with your booking, so we're going to take several of the food items off the bill."  And he delivered on that promise.  Not to mention, our waiter was totally spot on.Say what?  Seriously, I will love this Byron forever for the top notch way they handled a minor inconvenience.  Super classy folks.  No excuses, just awesome delivery.
